intro: Seseli iliense, commonly known as the Ilam seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or greenish flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
